text:
5 BIGGEST WINNERS FROM $TSM DOMINATE EARNINGS

1. $ASML sits at the choke point TSMC just confirmed with rising EUV intensity keeping wafer supply constrained into 2028‚Äì29
2. $NVDA benefits from a true allocation economy where scarce advanced wafers sustain GPU pricing power & margins
3. $AMKR sits at the next bottleneck after wafers where advanced packaging turns scarce silicon into deployable AI systems
4. $AMAT monetizes rising process intensity as hot fabs & advanced nodes drive more steps per wafer.
5. $AMD gains from the same supply-constrained backdrop with TSMC visibility supporting a multi-year CPU + GPU ramp

There‚Äôs been a lot of AI bear chatter lately, mostly using $META & $ORCL CapEx headlines to scare people. 

But $TSM is the lie detector since it sits at the physical bottleneck and they just told us capacity is tight into 2029.

That doesn‚Äôt sound like the end of a cycle to me.

$EOSE just launched Indensity which is a battery system built specifically for AI data centers that targets ~1 GWh per acre & ~4x the density of traditional storage.

It directly addresses the core DC problem which is having steady, dispatchable power to keep GPUs fully utilized so this storage solution helps capture excess generation & releases it during peak compute demand to make sure power supply isn't constant.

$AMZN made the AWS European Sovereign Cloud generally available with $NVDA Blackwell baked in.

This allows regulated European customers to run advanced AI workloads entirely in-region.

$BMNR plans a $200M equity investment in Beast Industries with potential DeFi integration tied to Beast‚Äôs upcoming financial platform.

Bitmine also plans to launch its MAVAN validator network in Q1 2026.

$TSM plans to raise CapEx from about $41B in 2025 to as much as $56B in 2026. 

That $15B+ step-up is TSMC telling you AI is shifting from building the brain during training to running the brain continuously through inference.

The more telling detail is that 10‚Äì20% of that spend is going into advanced packaging which is money going towards stitching multiple chips & high-bandwidth memory into a single system built to stay on.

That‚Äôs why advanced packaging is such a tell for whether these AI cities can actually be populated. You can announce data centers, order GPUs & sign power contracts but if memory bandwidth & power efficiency aren‚Äôt solved at the system level then you hit a wall. 

Packaging is the bridge between ‚Äúwe built the city‚Äù & ‚Äúthe city can actually run.‚Äù

$TSM CRUSHED THEIR EARNINGS

‚Ä¢ Sales $33.7B vs Est. $31.3B
‚Ä¢ EPS $3.14 vs Est. $2.79
‚Ä¢ Gross margin 62% vs Est. 61%
‚Ä¢ Net income $16.3B vs Est. $15.2B
‚Ä¢ Advanced nodes (‚â§7nm) were 77% of wafer revenue
